snippet: Wild chimpanzees have been caught on tape developing a new drinking utensil, with each animal learning the new technique by observing another do it.
abstract: Study in journal PLoS Biology reports that chimpanzees in Uganda have been caught on tape developing new drinking utensil, a mixture of moss and folded leaves that they place in their mouths and then dip into water; scientists say this is first time humans have observed origins of such behavior.
lead_paragraph: Wild chimpanzees have been caught on tape developing a new drinking utensil, with each animal learning the new technique by observing another do it.

headline.print_headline: Animal Behavior: Chimps Show a Thirst for Learning
headline.main: Chimps Show a Thirst for Learning
